meanings.definition: A large building or group of buildings fortified against attack with thick walls, battlements, towers, and in many cases a moat.
meanings.sent1: The old castle stood tall on the hill, surrounded by a deep moat.
meanings.sent2: Tourists often visit ancient castles to learn about history.
meanings.sent3: The castle's moat was so wide, even the ducks had trouble swimming across.
meanings.sent4: Her home felt like a castle, with its high walls protecting her from the world.
meanings.sent5: In his dreams, the castle was always under siege by dragons and knights.

meanings.sent1: Their new mansion looked more like a castle than a regular house.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy family lived in a grand castle overlooking the town.
meanings.sent3: The castle-like mansion had so many rooms, they often got lost inside.
meanings.sent4: The imposing castle on the hill seemed to watch over the entire village.
meanings.sent5: The castle of a house had a majestic presence that impressed all visitors.

meanings.definition: A chess piece, typically with a tower shape, that can move in any direction along a rank or file on which it stands.
meanings.sent1: The player moved the castle diagonally to protect the king.
meanings.sent2: In chess, the castle can be a powerful piece if used strategically.
meanings.sent3: The castle piece in the chess set always felt like the guardian of the board.
meanings.sent4: She used the castle to checkmate her opponent in a surprising move.
meanings.sent5: The castle piece moved swiftly across the board, capturing enemy pawns.
